title: Make path a requirement for parsing tilesets

milestone.description:
The refactor update
- Major interface changes
- Organize the code into separate modules
- Wrap around raw GIDs, provide a more sound interface
- Add more features such as group layer support, more examples, more documentation...

body:
This PR heavily simplifies tileset creation by making the root path a requirement, even if it is not used, and also removes the `SourceRequired` error. While this does force full-embedded tileset users* to use `PathBuf::default()` as the path instead of `None`, the internal simplifications make up for that extra allocation.

*Note: Since this crate does not support embedded images yet (The Tiled editor doesn't either), we can safely assume that those users do not exist.

title: Changed Rc<Tileset> to Arc<Tileset>

milestone.description:
The refactor update
- Major interface changes
- Organize the code into separate modules
- Wrap around raw GIDs, provide a more sound interface
- Add more features such as group layer support, more examples, more documentation...

body:
Hey, thanks for accepting my PR a few days ago.
It was my first contribution to an open source project!

Right now, I'm working on a project using the Bevy game engine and am making an AssetLoader for TiledMap.
Bevy is inherently multithreaded by design, and Assets can be shared across Threads, so they must implement Send + Sync.

I'm still new to Rust, and I found out the hard way that all structs implement Send + Sync automatically unless they have fields that do not implement Send + Sync.

Rc is one of those types.

It's for this reason that I'd like to change Rc<Tileset> to Arc<Tileset> as this would allow for a Map to be sent and shared between threads. I don't believe that this would impact performance much since the reference count for tilesets is really only changed during the creation and destruction of the map as far as I can tell. I'm not sure if this is subject to change.

I'd like to know what you guys think, though.

title: Add layer id parsing

milestone.description:
The refactor update
- Major interface changes
- Organize the code into separate modules
- Wrap around raw GIDs, provide a more sound interface
- Add more features such as group layer support, more examples, more documentation...

body:
Adds support for parsing the layer "id" attribute.
Unlike layer index, the id of a layer always stays the same, even if the order is changed or other layers are added/deleted.
(eg. this can be useful for identifying a layer in an int property on an object)

title: Add support for multiline string properties

milestone.description:
The refactor update
- Major interface changes
- Organize the code into separate modules
- Wrap around raw GIDs, provide a more sound interface
- Add more features such as group layer support, more examples, more documentation...

body:
If you enter a multiline string into a string property in the editor, it saves the string inside the xml node instead of inside the "value" attribute:
```xml
<property name="prop3">Line 1
Line 2
Line 3,
  etc
   </property>
```
which should be parsed as:
```
"Line 1\r\nLine 2\r\nLine 3,\r\n  etc\r\n   "
```

(I believe Tiled saves the file with the system's native line endings right? Not sure if the parsing in this PR should normalize it)

This PR adds support for parsing multiline strings like this.
It also adds such a property to the test files and adds a test to check that it works.

(feel free to suggest changes)

title: Reorganize crate

milestone.description:
The refactor update
- Major interface changes
- Organize the code into separate modules
- Wrap around raw GIDs, provide a more sound interface
- Add more features such as group layer support, more examples, more documentation...

body:
This is an updated version of #43. It splits `lib.rs` into the following modules:
- `animation`: For `Frame`
- `error`: For `ParseTileError` & `TiledError`
- `image`: For `Image`
- `layers`: For `LayerTile`, `Layer`, `LayerData`, `ImageLayer` & `Chunk`
- `map`: For `Map` & `Orientation`
- `objects`: For `ObjectGroup`, `ObjectShape` & `Object`
- `properties`: For `Colour`, `PropertyValue` & `Properties`
- `tile`: For `Tile`
- `tileset`: For `Tileset`
- `util`: Private, for all the macros & internal parse functions

While by itself this change won't improve the external interface by much, this reorganization will allow for further development on current types such as `Properties`, which is an alias right now, and is essential to allow for quickly browsing through the library.

title: Add support for file properties
body: fixes #59

title: Object visibility needs parsed string, too
body:
Layer and ObjectGroup are parsing the "visible" string, but Object seems to be missing this expression.
The [TMX docs](https://doc.mapeditor.org/en/stable/reference/tmx-map-format/#object) indicate that visible attribute is expected to be "0" or "1"

title: Feature-gate zstd so we can target wasm32-unknown-unknown
body:
Another option might be switching to [zstd-rs](https://github.com/KillingSpark/zstd-rs), but I haven't tested this and it seems that there would be a large performance penalty.

People who need compression and wasm can probably recompress with flate, so this seems like a good solution to me.

title: Add support for layer offsets
body:
What
====

* rust-fmt
* Add support for layer offset fields

Example layer with offset

```
<layer id="1" name="Layer 1" width="10" height="10" offsetx="0" offsety="32"> 
```

title: Add support for Infinite map
body:
This pull request adds support for infinite maps and would resolve #76 

It adds a breaking change to the Layer struct.

title: fix deprecated methods in Error
body:
`Error::description` and `cause` are deprecated, the new way of using `Error`s (since oct 2018) is with the `source` method.

This removes some warnings when compiling

title: add support for base64/zstd
body:
Add support for the recent format base64/zstd (default with current version of Tiled).

There is no tests yet, because I am not able to open a map in the assets directory and save it as base64/zstd without changing it's version and various properties in the file.

Maybe we should update all the maps to the newest format? (map version = 1.2)

title: Make fields on frame pub
body:
# Context
There doesn't seem to be a way to get at any of the fields on `Frame`.

Let's make it pub so we can poke at it.

# Technical
Ideally we'd add methods that just returned the tile id / duration without allowing modification of the source frame, but I decided to keep this in line with how the rest of the API looks.

Also, a minor rust fmt fix.

title: Refactor to 2018 edition
body: Hi! I'd like to add several features, but before that it would be nice to upgrade `rs-tiled` to a recent rust edition. That essentialy is what this PR about.

title: Fix tile flipping code
body: As @alec-deason rightly pointed out, I messed up the tile flipping code, as it's not encoded into the tileset, but at the layer level. I was kinda dumb, and just assumed that Tile just meant tiles for layers, not tiles for tilesets. To correct my mistake, I rolled back the changes and implemented a new struct: LayerTile. It not only stores the tile gid, but the flags as well. For good measure, I also made it #[derive] Eq, PartialEq, Debug, Clone and Copy, but this is a significant change from the u32 gids.

title: Version bump dependencies.
body: It doesn't ACTUALLY seem to make any differences, but I'm a little OCD like that.

title: Fix markdown formatting in CONTRIBUTORS file
body: The old version globs all names into a single paragraph when rendered to markdown.
